intro: Anil sparsa, commonly known as the slender anil, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Anil sparsa is often cultivated for its aromatic leaves, which are used in traditional medicine and culinary applications.
